stupidmodel.agents
Class Bug

java.lang.Object
  stupidmodel.agents.Bug

public class Bug
extends java.lang.Object

Bug agent implementation for StupidModel versions.

Agents in this model are very simple: they can access their neihgbourhood at a grid and move to a random position within sight range (that is a fixed constant for now, see Constants.BUG_VISION_RANGE.

If there is no free cell around the agent, it cannot move, so it stays in its current position.

From Model 12, agents are die and reproduce.

Since:
2.0-beta, 2011
Version:
$Id: Bug.java 461 2011-06-29 08:42:31Z richard.legendi@gmail.com $
Author:
Richard O. Legendi (richard.legendi)

Field Detail

size

private double size
Bugs have an instance variable for their size, which is initialized to 1.0.

maxConsumptionRate

private double maxConsumptionRate
Maximum food consumption of the bug (set to 1.0 by default).

survivalProbability

private double survivalProbability
A new bug parameter survivalProbability is initialized to 0.95. Each time step, each bug draws a uniform random number, and if it is greater than survivalProbability, the bug dies and is dropped.

Since:
Model 12

survivalProbability

step

public void step()
Implementation of the agent activity in each turn.

Agents work in a very simple way: they gather their neighbourhood and check for empty locations. If any is found, one of them is randomly chosen and the agent is relocated to that location.

getHabitatCellsForLocations

private java.util.List<repast.simphony.query.space.grid.GridCell<HabitatCell>> getHabitatCellsForLocations(java.util.List<repast.simphony.query.space.grid.GridCell<Bug>> freeCells)
Return the habitat cells for those grid points where no Bug agent is located at.

Parameters:
freeCells - list of cells where no agents is located at
Returns:
list of HabitatCell objects associated for the specified empty locations

grow

public void grow()
Each time step, a bug grows by a fixed amount, 1.0, and this action is scheduled after the move() action.

From Model 7, this function also verifies if the biggest bug reached size of 100, and if so, it stops the simulation.

Since:
Model 2, Model 7, Model 12

foodConsumption

protected double foodConsumption()
Bug growth is modified so growth equals food consumption.

Food consumption is equal to the minimum of (a) the bug's maximum consumption rate (set to 1.0) and (b) the bug's cell's food availability.

In previous models, a bug grew by a fixed amount of size in each time step.

Returns:
the actual eaten food value between the specified bounds; non-negative, lower or equal to maxConsumptionRate and foodAvailable
Since:
Model 3

getUnderlyingCell

protected HabitatCell getUnderlyingCell()
Returns the cell on which this agents is currently located at.

Also, it contains minor assertions and ensures invariants for the model: there should be exactly one cell for each agent, no more and no less. If either constraint is broken, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

Returns:
the cell on which the agent is currently located at; non-null
Since:
Model 3

mortality

public void mortality()
New activity for the agents in Model 12.
  • When a bug's size reaches 10, it reproduces by splitting into 5 new bugs. Each new bug has an initial size of 0.0, and the old bug disappears.
  • New bugs are placed at the first empty location randomly selected within +/- 3 cells of their parent’s last location. If no location is identified within 5 random draws, then the new bug dies.
  • A new bug parameter survivalProbability is initialized to 0.95. Each time step, each bug draws a uniform random number, and if it is greater than survivalProbability, the bug dies and is dropped.

Since:
Model 12

reproduce

protected void reproduce()
Perform the reproduction of an agent.

Since:
Model 12

die

public void die()
Simple utility function to show how to delete an agent.

In Model 16, it was modified since Predator agents can also kill a Bug, so it was modified to a public method.

Since:
Model 12, Model 16

setInitialSize

public void setInitialSize(cern.jet.random.Normal normal)
Two new model parameters were added to the model, and put on the parameter settings window: initialBugSizeMean and initialBugSizeSD.

Values of these parameters are 0.1 and 0.03. Instead of initializing bug sizes to 1.0 (as defined in previous models), sizes are drawn from a normal distribution defined by initialBugSizeMean and initialBugSizeSD. The initial size of bugs produced via reproduction is still 0.0.

Negative values are very likely to be drawn from normal distributions such as the one used here. To avoid them, a check is introduced to limit initial bug size to a minimum of zero.

Parameters:
normal - a properly initialized Normal distribution (cf. to RandomHelper documentation); cannot be null
Since:
Model 14

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
